awd_titl_txt: Ocean Acoustic Tomography in the Greenland Sea
awd_abstract_narration: The proposed work is the continuation and conclusion of the                     analysis of acoustic oceanographic data obtained by the                         principal investigator in the Greenland Sea Tomography                          Experiment. This experiment, conducted during 1988-89,                          consisted of a pentagonal array of five acoustic                                transceivers with a sixth moored in the center.  The                            goals of the experiment were to study the episodic formation                    of Greenland Sea Deep Water, the response of the Greenland                      Sea gyre to variations in wind stress and ice cover, and the                    propagation of acoustic energy in the marginal ice zone.                        The large data set obtained in this experiment, as well as a                    concurrent moving ship tomography test, and several other                       oceanographic studies, is currently being analyzed at four                      academic institutions.  This project will not only improve                      our understanding of deep water formation and circulation,                      but is also an excellent test of the utility of acoustic                        information in defining oceanographic processes.

inst.inst_name: University of California-San Diego Scripps Inst of Oceanography
